column2: TheresaJ860, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Woke up with excrutiating lower back pain, Dx'd with sprained ligaments/muscles. ER Dr. gave me shot of Toradol, and the relief was so amazing!  I recv'd a 5 day supply of pills, which were wonderful. I also suffer from Systemic Lupus and degenerative arthritis, which have me living in constant pain. This medication actually gave me such incredible relief, for the entire week it was amazing that all my pain was either gone,or more bareable than it has been in years!  Wish it was available for long term use! Everything else is so disappointing since experiencing the great pain relief from this medication.

column2: cupcake, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from frequent migraines for two years following a car accident.  My family doctor is well aware, and will usually fit me in between patients for a demerol shot.  As my doctor was on vacation, received both vistaril and toradol injections.  The injection was more painful than receiving cortizone, and within an hour, was suffering severe abdominal pain with diarrhea, as well as heavy twitching.  Once finally falling asleep, nightmares, sweating and serious thrashing occured.  The migraine disappeared within 30 minutes, and I walked out with a smile because the pain was gone.  The side effects, however, were bad enough to put these both on my never again list!  I will have to say, however, that it was nice to have headache relief without feeling stoned out of my gourd!

column2: Trueoutlaw29, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column9: Duration of pain relief di not  make  takingthis medication worth and damage it may cause in extended use.

column2: ruthb51, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I went to my ortho dr for wrist pain 4 mos after carpal tunnel surgery. I also have pain from osteoarthritis and nothing helps it.I was given a shot of toradol. Other than some dizziness 2 hrs after the shot(which was told would not happen), there was NO relief.Now 3 days later I want to take something for neck and back pain but don't know if I can take anything until I call the dr since its only been 3 days. Quote from PubMed Health :Ketorolac is used for the short-term relief of moderately severe pain and should not be used for longer than 5 days, for mild pain, or for pain from CHRONIC (long-term) conditions. Chronic like arthritis?

column2: grateful sufferer, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Went to ER with severe migraine with nausea & vomiting. Received IV with Toradol, Compazine and Benadryl. The migraine subsided in 30 minutes. A great drug!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Went to ER for severe tooth pain, scale from 1-10, was a 12.  Given Toradol IM resulting in pain down to nothing within 15-20 minutes.  Was given darvocet for pain next day, but made me very sick.  Two days  later intolerable pain, Toradol took care of it again.  Very grateful for this drug!(fractured root canal tooth source of pain removed)

column2: giraffus, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: ONE TIME USE OF TORADOL IM SHOT AT DOCTOR'S OFFICE FOR SORE THROAT VIRUS COMBIINED WITH MIGRAINE.  PAIN OF MIGRAINE SUBSIDED WITHIN 2 HOURS.  PAIN RETURNED DURING THE NIGHT WITH POOR SLEEP QUALITY FROM SORE THROAT.

The shot itself made my arm very sore but it did start to work after 20 minutes. I did have mild pain afterwards but nothing compared to when i first went in.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Received IM/IV for lumbar back strain. Very good pain control without the "stoned" effect you can get from narcotic. Will use again if needed.

column2: Milo, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given an injection of Toradol in the ER following an accidental injury. To be honest, it was difficult to tell how well the medicine worked at relieving my pain, but the injection itself was not painful at all, at no doubt the anti-inflammatory effects of the medicine were beneficial, because I experienced fewer body aches than I would have expected afterwards. I have taken oral Toradol in the past, and it has proven somewhat effective, which is why they decided to give me this in the ER. No side effects noted, but they did make sure to check that I had not taken my last regular dose of anti-inflammatory (Mobic) for almost 24 hours before giving me the injection.

column2: junnie8787, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My Daughter was treated for a week long migraine. It did nothing for the migraine, but it did make her passout and when she came too she shook uncontrollby for 45 mins.

column2: sue, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 74, have liver disease, have had ulcers.  Was given in hosp for kidney stone pain. Worked slow.  I am seeing MD tomorrow due to ongoing stomach and liver pain 5 days after last dose.  It can cause death.  It SHOULD NOT have been used for me.  They knew of liver disease and age.  BEWARE.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Toradol IM injections for my very painfil migraines. This is the only medication that gave me relief from all pain from my migraines! Because of the high risk in side effects I was taken off this medication after 4 months, but I was only able to administer 2 injections/week. So far no migraines since, im concerned how I will treat future migraine pain, I guess back to the ER for relief! :(
